issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: Dependency on commons-httpclient::commons-httpclient was removed from hadoop-common. Downstream projects using commons-httpclient transitively provided by hadoop-common need to add explicit dependency to their pom. Since commons-httpclient is EOL, it is recommended to migrate to org.apache.httpcomponents:httpclient which is the successor.

fields.summary: Remove dependency on commons-httpclient for TestHttpServerLogs

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Remove dependency on commons-httpclient for ServletUtil

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: hadoop-common has undeclared dependency on {{org.apache.httpcomponents:httpclient}} and unused dependency on {{commons-httpclient:commons-httpclient}}. Vise versa in hadoop-azure and hadoop-openstack.

This message was automatically generated.

+1 

There is a risk that something downstream depended on the POM dependencies. Can you tag this as a potentially incompatible ("may affect downstream projects depending on the POM") change?

Sure. The downstream projects implicitly using commons-httpclient provided as transient dependency of hadoop-common need to update the POM. The fix is not urgent and not worth to bother downstream projects. I think it's ok to make this trunk-only.

[Compatibility guide currently does not state a policy for dependencies|https://hadoop.apache.org/docs/r2.7.1/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/Compatibility.html#Java_Classpath], for reference.

given that azure ships, I do think it should go in ... it just needs to be something to be aware of.

or: you split it up so the azure side patch goes in, but the hadoop-common one is postponed to trunk
HADOOP-12625 added dependency on commons-httpclient. HADOOP-12710 will fix this.

This message was automatically generated.
I think it would be better to commit this to branch-2 too now, in order to avoid classes of commons-httpclient to be used further. We need to fix HADOOP-12711 at first for this.

[~iwasakims] thanks for the work. This patch also depends on HADOOP-11613 (Remove httpclient dependency from hadoop-azure) and HADOOP-11614 (Remove httpclient dependency from hadoop-openstack) Could you also review that two JIRAs as well? Thanks again.

I updated the patch. Since HADOOP-11613 came in, we don't need to fix hadoop-azure/pom.xml.

HADOOP-11614 seems to need more time. I would like to fix the dependency of hadoop-common first. We can update hadoop-openstack/pom.xml later in HADOOP-11614.
